body_html:
OK, this gives me much more information, thanks!
Here is the compilation error:

ERROR: /home/simon/Desktop/tensorflow/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/BUILD:649:1: C++ compilation of rule '//tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu:infeed_manager' failed (Exit 1)
In file included from ./tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/infeed_manager.h:23:0,
                 from tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/infeed_manager.cc:16:
./tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/xfeed_queue.h:68:37: error: 'std::function' has not been declared

Looking at that last part of the error, I found this:
https://www.bountysource.com/issues/49075870-compilation-error-loader-resourceloader-h-101-100-error-std-function-has-not-been-declared-loader-resourceloader-h-101-108-error-expected-or-before-token

Looks like this can be something in latest gcc, @jlebar @Artem-B to weigh in on that.

One thing you can try.
In our configuration script, it asks you if you like to use "clang" to compile:
Do you want to use clang as CUDA compiler?
Could you pick "clang" to compile, and when it asks, you will need to tell it to download and use latest clang.

body:
OK, this gives me much more information, thanks!
Here is the compilation error:
```
ERROR: /home/simon/Desktop/tensorflow/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/BUILD:649:1: C++ compilation of rule '//tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu:infeed_manager' failed (Exit 1)
In file included from ./tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/infeed_manager.h:23:0,
                 from tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/infeed_manager.cc:16:
./tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/gpu/xfeed_queue.h:68:37: error: 'std::function' has not been declared
```

Looking at that last part of the error, I found this:
https://www.bountysource.com/issues/49075870-compilation-error-loader-resourceloader-h-101-100-error-std-function-has-not-been-declared-loader-resourceloader-h-101-108-error-expected-or-before-token

Looks like this can be something in latest gcc, @jlebar @Artem-B to weigh in on that.

One thing you can try.
In our configuration script, it asks you if you like to use "clang" to compile:
`Do you want to use clang as CUDA compiler?`
Could you pick "clang" to compile, and when it asks, you will need to tell it to download and use latest clang.
